However, during this time she begins to fall in love with Kyle which results in another problem down the line caused inadvertently by Emily. At any rate, as far as this movie is concerned, although it is billed as a comedy-drama-romance it actually doesn't have that much comedy. At least there wasn't much humor that I could see. Additionally, the plot was rather thin and some of the scenes seemed to drag here and there. But Miley Cyrus performed rather well and Ashley Henshaw certainly added to the scenery. Even so, neither one of these qualities were enough to elevate this film into the average range. That said, although it may appeal to a younger audience I rate this film as slightly below average.

reviews.review_title: Not as Bad as critics say
reviews.content: LOL – CATCH IT (B) First thing first LOL is not as bad as critics say maybe it's not as good as original French movie was. Even though it has the Worst break-up scene I have ever seen in movie's Histroy". LOL is a story of a teenage girl growing up and falling in love, getting cheated on and dealing with separation of their parents. Miley Cyrus looks chic but I think at times she went overboard plus she is not that great of an actress and since we want strong female actress to lead teen movies she falls short. Douglas Booth is another charming British lad can't wait to see him in Romeo & Juliet. Jessica Hinshaw & Ashley Green are gorgeous. Demi Moore and Jay Hernandez sizzle on screen. Austin Nicoles, Thomas Jane, Jean-Luc Bilodeau and George Finn are fine in it. On the whole, LOL is an enjoyable teen movie with great soundtracks and good production value.

reviews.review_title: So many bad things I could say about this movie
reviews.content: First let me say this...this movie lacked plot. I watched about 30 minutes of it wondering when it was going to get good. So I decided to watch the whole thing it never had a plot. That is probably what bothered me the most. However I am not going to slam down as a god awful movie either because I have seen worse. Let me tell you what is good about it or what I really think the writers and makers of this movie were going for. First the movie showed what teenage life is like now. With social media, texting, partying, drinking, drugs and relationships: It was not sugar coded material which is nice I guess. Second, It had some relate to characters. Lola, being a teen trying to live her own life. A mother trying to deal with being a single parent. I would some what say they did a fair job at that. However there is so much bad you can say about this movie. Even though I thought Miley was great in The Last Song however I think her acting days are numbered. I also think her singing career is to but hey this about her acting. I felt like she could have given more to her character as Lola. I also think they lack of character develop could had done that. Again I could say so many bad things about this movie you can read other reviews on their experience of this movie. In short, I would not recommend this movie on less you want to watch something just because. I would recommend Cyperbully which has Emily Osment as the lead. Very emotional movie and a great example what social media is like these days.

reviews.review_title: Truly the most awful movie I've ever had the misfortune to watch
reviews.content: With a terrible, nonsensical, unnecessarily extended plot line, juvenile dialogues and laughable characters, this movie really takes the cake for one of the most awful 93 minutes of my life.I honestly felt as though I was watching a visual representation of a teen-drama Wattpad novel, authored by a tween. The movie is as if directed by a 12 year old. It's not just that the story line is removed from reality, it's that it is painfully so. One of the things that bothered me about the movie was that it portrayed teen relationships and beahaviour as so stereotypical and centred around the clichéd "sex, drugs and rock and roll" theme. This, among other things in the movie was so removed from reality that it was irritating. Another thing was, it showed female best friends (NOT in a romantic relationship) casually making out on a daily basis as a greeting and it being perceived as completely normal by everyone else in the film. It's a part of the whole "removed from reality thing" but very vexing to watch, just the same.If I could give it less than one star, I would. Absolute waste of time and reel.
This was a really good coming of age movie. Great acting & story line. Watch it for yourself.

It's painful to watch. All the characters are shallow, self serving, and not like-able in any way. If this came from Hollywood, it makes me wonder what those in Hollywood think about contemporary culture in the USA. Maybe that was their goal, to showcase the failures and superficial nature of the current youth of America. If that was indeed their goal, they did a good job. But more likely, they intended this to be an edgy teen movie to be consumed by the younger masses. It fails there too though. The conflicts between the characters are weak, and not compelling, to each their own, I just couldn't get into it. I think they could have done a better job of building at least one like-able character that viewers could identify with, but it never happens.

reviews.review_title: don't judge a movie by it's actors
reviews.content: I would give this movie a 7.5 or 8. This movie wasn't exceptional; it won't win an Oscar or a people's choice award, but it wasn't a waste of time to see. I've seen the original LOL (subtitles and all) and I don't understand how this one was "worse" or "mocking" it. I enjoyed it. It was a good way to spend my evening. Miley Cyrus executed her character well. People are giving her a bad rep because of her previous movies; I'm not the biggest fan of hers myself. However, she did well in this movie. It wasn't a hard part to play but she did well. And all the other characters did well too. Between the original movie and this one, nothing was different except that this one was in English and had different actors. This movie won't change your life by all means, but if you're looking for a romantic teen movie to watch, this one will serve you well. It's meant for teens (just like the writer/director envisioned) so don't go in expecting "The Notebook" because it will not give you what you're looking for. I hope this helps.
This movie is amazing worth a watch! Gives you in insight of high school.

reviews.review_title: not as bad as people say, its acuatlly good
reviews.content: its like a teen type movie so yeah its not for old people, its also not a real teen movie. they got a little drama, romance, girl problems, boy problems, drug problems and other crap. Miley Cyrus can get annoying and the movie has plenty of low spots and a few good ones. Demi Moore is cool and her character is not that great as well. i enjoyed the flick and it should be better but its not bad by any means.watch it, have fun the films enjoyable and have fun. don't expect the greatest movie ever this is not a serious movie. nothing clever about it, not much of a plot or anything its like a amusing way to kill time so watch it and have a few laughs.

It's a movie you can watch easily.Doesn't require any attention 'cause the plot is very simple.It's just another chick-flick.The cast is good. And actors' interpretations are surprisingly good.Gives you quite monoptical view of teenagers life,but has some real world problems which was an good thing to notice.Music is good.But the plot is very empty.The scene were Miley snicks Douglas in the host home is really stupid.They could have thought of something much better.It is worth watching if you're a teen girl.Nothing that will blow your mind.I am not sure if the relationship between the two protagonists is what a relationship really is or what it should be,so the message that comes about relationships isn't a healthy one.

reviews.review_title: Great Chick flick. Why all the complaints?
reviews.content: I had very low expectations of this movie considering all the reviews I read before watching it, but now, afterward, I am happy to say that I enjoyed it from beginning to end.The story was scripted full of clichés and had quite cheesy lines, which I personally didn't mind considering it being a total chick flick. I am a sucker for these kind of movies and guessing it is for a younger adult/teenage audience, it fit me perfectly. Sure, it's a Hollywood movie, it doesn't mirror real life very well at all, but all those small details in behaviors, issues and thoughts are fun to recognize yourself in as a teenager yourself.The actors were great, I don't know what's up with all the fuzz about Miley, I am not a hardcore fan, but I really enjoyed her performance in The Last song, which was quite a lot a more of a serious movie, but I have no complaints about this one. She plays her roll well and so does the whole cast. It does have a kind of "Mean girls" feeling to it, just not as dramatic and extreme, which I find positive because they become a little bit more real. Realistic for being a Hollywood movie.It fulfilled everything I could think of because I can't find anything bad to say about it. It has love and relationships being reflected from different angles; boyfriend-girlfriend, mother-daughter and friendship. I think there can be something for everyone whether you're a little sister or a grandmother, the only requirement is not expecting a Oscar performance movie, but being open about having a few laughs. Because that's what this movie can bring you.

This is a great movie for moms to watch with their teenage daughters that are struggling to open up and trust that moms are there for them. I watched it with my teen and really enjoyed it. It was very relatable at this stage our lives.

reviews.review_title: Good movie! I don't understand all the negative reviews!
reviews.content: I really don't understand all the hate that this movie is getting. I mean, maybe I just loved it because I'm a fourteen year old girl that loves chick flicks, but I thought that the movie was very cute and relate able. Sure, I'm not the biggest Miley fan, but I thought that she was great in the movie and the chemistry that she had with the other actors was amazing, and to me, that made up for the lack of acting ability for most of the actors. When I saw all the awful reviews here, I was hesitant to watch the movie, but I did, mainly because I was bored, and well, Douglas Booth is extremely attractive. But now, I'm glad that I saw the movie and I would definitely watch it again. Not the world's greatest movie, but not the worst either and overall, I really enjoyed it. Definitely the kind of movie to watch with your mom, your best friend, at a sleepover, or even when you're by yourself and bored! Seriously, if your a teenage girl, or just have a passion for chick flicks, go watch this movie! I promise you won't regret it!

This movie is a little bit of a jump for Cyrus in acting from Disney to this movie. NO SPOILERS: Language: S' word is dropped once..maybe twice, then there's the usual words..damn, hell, b*tch, and ass. Violence/Gore: Miley gets slapped across the face once, nothing graphic.Sexual Content/Nudity: No Nudity shown at all in the film. Miley has 2 "sensual" scenes in bed nothing crazy graphic, it's shown she still has her bra on in both moments. Cyrus is seen kissing another girl for .1 second and that's it/ nothing crazy graphic. Dialague: Cyrus's Brizillian is brought up once. Teenage sexuality is referenced for a moment. Mild references are made between girls, not crazy much. Children under 15 should not see this film with out a parental unit present.

I am not sure why few people have disliked this movie !!This movie is not about Miley Cyrus at all. The overall feeling of this movie is pretty good. The movie covers very small and often unnoticed feelings that teenage life goes through. A lot of them may be irrelevant to future life, may be utterly foolish ( if you recall now ), but the fact is ; everyone goes through them in their respective lives.One peculiar thing in this movie is Kyle. He looks awesome in this movie and girls can't leave him going unnoticed.No accolades for acting, script or story but still this movie grips you. A one-time worth watching for sure.

I'm not a big fan of Miley Cyrus but this one is much different and more interesting than any movies she has done before. I think that Miley Cyrus did improve from her other movies such as The Last Song. In this movie she has to play a difficult teenager. I don't think that guys would like this movie. I felt that some parts were to cheesy. The music was good. Demi Moore in this movie is the mum of the difficult teenager Lola (Cyrus) she did an okay job but nothing impressive. To many clichés and not that much of a plot. If you like the 'teen rebel' kind of movie this is probably for you. I would never watch this again. If you have a girls night then this is probably the movie you should rent. As I said before this is not like anything Miley Cyrus has done before so it might shock the viewers of Hannah Montana.

LOL is a remake of the French film "LOL (Laughing Out Loud)", released in 2008. I'm not familiar with the original, so I will evaluate this picture as a separate work.On the whole, this is another film about teenage life - studies, problems, relationships with parents, peers and lovers. There is nothing new here, no serious drama - there are two main lines - teenagers' relationships with their parents and with the opposite sex, with the theme of parents and friendship touched upon a little in the background.The acting was unimpressive - everyone played average. There was a feeling that the cast was chosen only by external data and do not care about the skills of the game, they say that works for teenagers, too. There is nothing to talk about, because all the time we are watching just beautiful faces, who are not able to show any emotions. Sometimes I felt like I was watching a puppet show or a fashion show, although the visuals don't look appealing either - the picture is pale and mundane. Even a city as vibrant and beautiful as Paris is shown here not very attractive.The soundtrack is cheerful - a lot of pop songs that are popular with young people. The music fits well as a background to the narration, without standing out in any way. It sets the tone, softens some roughnesses in the narrative and makes watching more enjoyable.In the end, "LOL" is a typical teen drama, with the same problems as shown in a hundred other movies. It's not awful and it's okay to watch, but I seem to have long outgrown the age at which something like this is catching on.

I find its very bizarre that many people dint like this movie...I absolutely enjoyed from the start till the end, its amazing how the mother and daughter relationship is! And finally its gets to me about how Kyle father finally feels that his son is good at something that he never that thought he would go along with.. And people seriously stop comparing with the French movie, its got its own unique style..Just enjoy and thing from character's point of view How's its played!! and life goes..LOL!! - loved it...

I wonder the entire movie what the plot was bever really seemed to be leading anywhere loads of random sub plots that gave little bad ending like what was point of the paris trip they made up on the flight could have been resolved on the subway also no indication of the spaceing between events one big skip but they redered to it in the movie like it was yesterday

reviews.review_title: Not really laugh out loud but okay
reviews.content: This is an upbeat pleasant comedy drama about a teenage girl (Miley) and her single mom (Demi) and their romantic relationships. No one is really evil. It's not that funny as the title would suggest.Miley's love interest is played by Douglas Booth who looks a bit out of her league. Nice to see Ashley Greene as "The Post-it". The dialog is a bit fast to catch. The directing is a bit hectic. It's nice to see a mother and daughter who love each other instead of just fighting.Only problem is the message it's sending - it's okay to have intercourse at that age? Overall it won't go down as the greatest teen movie but it's okay for one watch.

A film made with very little backing from the studio and a ton of legal trouble. Cmon. What did you expect. It's a movie directed at young teens who are miley cyrus fans. They didn't set out to win oscars.All the annoying men on here commenting on miley cyrus' looks are embarrassing themselves. It's a bad movie, i won't deny it. But it's harmless fun. It's got a great cast (like actually shockingly star studded) and it's just fun for young teens.Shut up.

Where do I start? The one girl is so horny she makes out with the local creep because she can't score with her teacher. The one kid's dad discovers his son has pot so he smashes his son's guitar right in front of him. These teens go on a trip to Paris for French class, their only adult supervision is the biggest pushover in teaching history. This movie is if The Secret Life Of The American Teenager had an affair with Billy Ray Cyrus and the result is some warped Miley Cyrus teen drama garbage. Avoid at all costs.

Okay so I'm not a huge fan of Miley Cyrus (to be honest I really can't stand her) but I decided to watch this movie anyway. From the previews I could tell it wasn't going to be a great movie so I didn't go into it expecting much. There were some moments that were cringe-worthy and I wished I could reach through the screen and slap some of the characters but overall I actually liked this movie. It probably really helped that the guy playing Kyle was GORGEOUS!!! Adults are not gonna love this but I'm sure teens could definitely relate. You see three generations of women trying to cope with one another and learn how to grow up. Plus the music is fantastic and it'll be stuck in your head for a while :)

First things first: have you seen the original french movie this is based on? Yes? Ok then you really do not need to watch this, since it does copy most of the origina, but mostly falls on its back trying. Has some solid moments too, but overall it is the original french movie that comes away as the better film. If you haven't seen it - well I don't have to explain to you what you should be doing instead of watching this remake ... do I? I hope not.Also while I have no issue with Miley Cyrus in general (she seems like a cool individual), she does seem to old for the role she's supposed to play and cannot carry the weight of many of the scenes ... compared to the original, but also generally speaking. Still this boasts a lot of stars and may therefor be something you want to watch. Also if you don't like subtitles ... but again, in comparison this lacks. Sophie Marceau is so much better than Demi Moore (whom I do like as an actress) ... I reckon you should be informed enough to make your own decision.

I had been wanting to see this movie when I first saw the trailer. I waited for it to come out in theatres. All of the sudden its on demand. OKAY THEN.I'm not that great of a Miley Cyrus fan and there were times when her acting made me want to turn the movie off...But I don't understand how this movie is now the worst thing anyone has seen. It isn't. Trust me.I was not super impressed, but some of the way things were set up were nice. Although things got confusing at the end. Like some one was actually going to go somewhere with it, but got lazy.I'm not say to stop your life to watch this movie. But if you're bored, its a nice time filler/late night movie.
I love the movie, it's great! Not the best i've ever seen in technical terms but still I think that good art has gotta make u feel something! And this movie makes u feel soo good!!!

"LOL" is a Comedy - Romance movie in which we watch a teenage girl breaking up with her boyfriend while her best friend reveals his feelings for her. She has to figure out what she truly wants, her plan after finishing high school and deal with some family issues.I have to admit that I did not have high expectations from this movie and I also had some time to waste, that was the main reason watching it. The plot was simple, predictable and boring at many points. The direction which was made by Lisa Azuelos was below average and I believe that she did not do her best. Regarding the interpretations of the cast, they all followed the pattern of the movie with none of them be above average. Lastly, I have to say that "LOL" is another average comedy teenage movie as many others so, I do not recommend you to watch it because you will waste your time.

I loved this movie so much. It's simple and sweet. Got to admit it doesn't have much of a story line. But they carried out the movie really well. My mom and I watched it and we could both totally relate to it. From the iPod in the car to everything. Miley did a very could job, not for once did I feel like I was watching 'Hannah Montana' (I used to watch it regularly). She became Lola. And Demi was perfect. And I'm so happy they decided to make India the place for the world premiere. very few movies do that. But anyway loved it and hope you people do too, when you get to see it. And don't judge Miley by her Disney image, just imagine she's just another actor playing a part, you'll find you'll love the movie and the sweet and simple message it conveys.

Well i am Tajera. This is my review on the movie LOL. It is very great. I would seriously recommend people to watch this. Miley Cyrus is a very great actress and played this role to the best of her ability. I think this is a must see show!!People wouldn't watch the show because they don't like Miley but it is a very interesting show!! i recommend that its really great!! The actors are very great! The script is very well thought out! its a hard hitting movie i honestly love it! Well i am not just saying that because i am a Miley Cyrus fan i am saying it because i know good movies when i see it and let me tell you that LOL is one! Well this is my second review and i think i am doing very great.I hope you like it.Well i know you would! once again i am Tajera and this is my daily movie review!!

reviews.review_title: Can it get any worse than this 'film'?
reviews.content: No, it cannot. Quite honestly, this is the single worst film I've ever seen. "Lol" is certainly my reaction to Miley Cyrus' 'acting'. Demi Moore? Seriously? And whomever wrote this garbage script should never be allowed to write so much as a Thank You Cars ever again.

reviews.review_title: The teen drama is ambiguous and insipid, born of dumb lies, apparent misunderstandings, and a triangle of almost identical hipster children.
reviews.content: For a movie cleverly-if-cutely named "LOL" (the name of the main girl is Lola, shortened to the omnipresent slang of the internet) with the mawkish tagline of "You can change your status but not your heart," there is very little laughing out loud or shifting status going on with the characters in the film, to say even less for the audience. The teen drama is ambiguous and insipid, born of dumb lies, apparent misunderstandings, and a triangle of almost identical hipster children. Miley Cyrus rocks her honey blonde hair, but with her thick drawl she's still scrunchy-faced and faux-angry and likely can't speak a word of French.Ashley Greene, herself, seems to be conscious that at this school she is the only super-senior looking twenty-five-year-old fawning over the boys. Also Demi Moore is made of wood.

reviews.review_title: More for teens but still good
reviews.content: This is a movie that is angled towards younger teens. However, it touches on things that many teens experience throughout their life. It does a wonderful job of following Lola while she is attempting to learn how to be her own person.While the acting was a bit interesting at times it really is one of Miley's better movies. Leaps and bounds past The Last Song which was a wonderful movie even though her acting was not.If your expecting a wonderful master minded movie then this is not for your. However if your looking for an easy watch then it's not a waste of time.

The first Hollywood movie to release in India first...Demi Moore does an excellent job as a mom with plenty at hand..Miley too is pretty cool as a troubled yet normal teenager...Ashley Greene is always welcome to take a break from all vampires n werewolves... the movie is awesome in all its dealing with normal people getting caught in tricky situations...like all teens, the movie has plenty of small, small problems which melt away with some nice warm hugs :)) Must watch for all human drama lovers...the guys unfortunately play peripheral roles...The movie is running to empty halls in Mumbai and am sure everywhere else in India too, same story repeats...nevertheless, watch it and enjoy !!

I can honestly say that when the hype surrounding Miley Cyrus started I wasn't that interested in her. I checked out her TV Shows etc and all I could hear was a nasal-y voice and a girl who was so chirpy it wasn't funny.I love Nicolas Sparks' movies, all of them. Then I found out Miley was in The Last Song and I wasn't too happy but decided to watch cause the guy was a babe. The first few sentences I heard the nasal voice and I was put off but then I continued to listen and it disappeared and it was like her personality came through and really enjoyed it. From then on I liked Miley.I gave LOL a go because I like Chick Flicks and I'm not ashamed to admit it. This movie is pretty similar to real life, just a little more dramatic (as are most movies).I compare this to Angus, Thongs and Perfect Snogging. Aimed at younger girls but can be enjoyed by all. There were some super cute scenes in it, cute boys and they were addressing issues that are faced by all ages.Definitely not the best movie I've ever seen but I would watch it again for sure!

reviews.review_title: Miley Cyrus believable as troubled teen.
reviews.content: I ran across LOL on Netflix. I'd heard about the movie earlier and wanted to see it, however it never made it to theaters around me and I never caught it on TV. The story is basic: a girl with divorced parents is trying to find herself among various influences. She does drugs, thinks about sex all the time, and drinks. She goes against her mother's wishes and throws a big party. Mind you, she maintains a very strong relationship with her mom through the movie's entirety.Miley Cyrus isn't the best actress, but her role as Lola was believable. I felt like she was Lola and her emotions were in tact.I would compare this movie to Perks of Being a Wallflower in that teens are trying to find who they are among the pressure to drink, pressure to smoke, pressure to have sex, and most of all the pressure of parents to be perfect.I definitely would recommend this movie. I enjoyed it. Not for anyone under, say, 15, but a good movie overall.5/10 because I felt like there could be more action. The whole movie was just about her drinking, smoking, and trying to get revenge on her ex Chad. Even when she goes to Paris, she's just trying to have sex with her boyfriend. Lola needs a life that has adventure and she needs to put up the bottles and blow out the joint!

reviews.review_title: Not as bad as everyone's saying...
reviews.content: I've not seen the original French version that everyone's saying this was supposed to be a (failed) remake of so maybe this is actually a good thing for me? I had no idea this wasn't original, and personally I really enjoyed it :D I'm 16 and a girl so I'm guessing I'd be counted as the target audience, and although this wasn't a very deep film, I enjoyed it as a light and funny film that I could relate to :) I'm not a movie critic so my opinion probably doesn't mean anything, but I didn't see any problem with the acting, the script was okay and the soundtrack was brilliant :D I loved how many songs came up that I know and enjoy :)Anyway, point is that this is a great, fun film for someone my age, although it won't be running for any awards any time soon :)

I found this movie on Netflix after being in the mood for a silly teen movie. I knew it wasn't going to be great, but I didn't expect the absolute depth of it's awfulness. Actually the worse movie I have ever seen. Horrendous acting, horrendous scenarios, just absolute trash. The cringe factor is through the roof. Even if you have time to waste, don't waste it on this movie. Ugh.

This film only appeals to people who are between the ages of 13-17 and mostly appeals to girls, if your watching this and your a 38 year old man, it's pretty clear you won't like it.At times this film gives me goosebumps because of all the moments between Lola (Miley Cyrus) and Her Mum who share a really close relationship. The Group of friends in school contain boys and girls who are mostly paired up in relationships, Typical School life and a heart warming story. A few famous actors who I recognised star in the film which made it all the better. Good acting through-out and a good story line One of my favourite films, don't understand all the bad reviews.

First of all, I'm far away from being Miley fan, I just tolerate her, but it doesn't mean that I reject everything she's in. I rather enjoyed Last Song and it's the same case with this movie, it's just not that bad as many people say. There are much worse things around and there is plenty of them. OK, you won't find great acting, storytelling or cinematography here, but overall it's really OK. If you would watch only great movies than you would see them maybe once or twice a year, if you are lucky. I have just watched this one and although it's not great, I don't regret it, I just spent some nice time with it. There is some review that spends a lot of space comparing it with Juno. Dude, you don't compare Orwell, Sallinger, Cortazar or Marquez with Larsson, Rowling or Grisham - they are in completely different leagues, but it doesn't mean that you can't enjoy all of them, just different ways. Don't let the negative reviews put you off from it or you might loose something you would really enjoy, even more than I. I gave it 10/10 in my humble attempt to make it's rating a little better, but it really deserves 6/10 right there in the middle (no 0 on IMDb so 5 would be below), because for me, it's exactly where it is.

reviews.review_title: Much Better Than I Ever Woulda Thought
reviews.content: Critics will obviously hate this movie once they hear it stars "Miley Cyrus"... they won't even give it a chance. They're stubborn.The movie needs to be watched with an open-mind.Not a huge MC fan, but I loved this movie.It was 100,000x better than expected and the concept is so relatable and the acting is so spot-on that it's almost freaky!11/10 stars for impressing me! ;) So didn't expect such a great movie. Critics BETTER watch before judging, because they'll be astounded and utterly surprised!GOOD JOB, MILEY! WOW!

reviews.review_title: Cute teen movie for chill nights
reviews.content:
I have watched this movie 5 times for sure alredy. First time I was only 15 so of course I could really empathize with everything that was going on.Of course, it's not an artistic movie, you will not learn anything, but the vibe of it, the relationships, friendships and everything that is happening, I think it's very enjoyable.If you're looking for chill movie with teenager drama, love, highschool, I think it's perfect. But if you only want to see deep, meaningful movies, not really...
I think the mother-daughter relationship it's also interesting.I don't understand why it has such a low rating. It's not an oscar movie, but it's ok. I like Miley Cyrus as an actress too.

reviews.review_title: Don't believe all the negative reviews
reviews.content: This movie was so badly panned, that I thought it must be the worst movie ever made. Normally, I don't read reviews, but there were so many negative reviews, and I'd never even heard of this movie.I'm a big Miley fan, so I thought, how bad can it be? Also, Demi Moore. And, the movie was great. The acting, the story, the music, cinematography, style... I loved it. The bond between Demi and Miley was so strong, and their on-screen relationship so real, it reminded me completely of my relationship with my teenage daughter. It's love hate. Mostly love, and the love is what matters.Some people were asking for a real review, not just an attack by someone who was a devotee of the original in French. I never saw it. Maybe it was great, but who cares. Miley was GREAT here in a more adult role than Hannah Montana or that she played in her previous roles. She played it great. She's a great actress. So is Demi. They deserve better than this.If you like Miley, if you liked Hannah Montana, if you don't need a blockbuster movie every time but just want to see some good acting on the part of some good actors, real emotions, Marlo Thomas is in it and does a great job, there's humor, and she provides some of it, feel free to see this movie. It's not really a bad movie, and Miley, Demi and Marlo are great in it.

Love this film. All these reviews really overthinking the point of the film. It's a sweet coming of age and all my friends loved it when they saw as teens. That's the audience it is aimed at not weird 48 year old men who have some obsession with all the sex and profanity in the film. This real life brother. Get used to it.

reviews.review_title: An Under-Rated Film and here's why...
reviews.content: Starring in her first major film following the hit "Hannah Montana" television series, Miley Cyrus shows to audiences a different side of her. That is why it is easy to see why this film was received so poorly by audiences - this is not a film for the Disney crowd. Instead "LOL" is a complete departure of the wholesome "perfect teen" image of Hannah Montana and instead captures a deeper, truer image of today's average teenager. When viewed in this context, the Hannah Montana fan-base may be disappointed but Miley Cyrus fans will be captivated by her performance and all audiences are sure to agree that "LOL" is a transition for the multi-talented actress.

reviews.review_title: Just because you don't like Miley...
reviews.content: ...doesn't mean you instantly have to rate the movie bad. Some people have been giving it bad reviews just because of Miley being in the movie and they haven't even seen it yet.A lot of people have said that they enjoyed the movie, and Miley's acting. Half of these people didn't even like Miley, so she could not have been as bad as you are all making her out to be. Even from the trailer, you can see that her acting isn't bad. It's actually pretty good. And if you moved on from disliking her because of things she's done in her personal life (which doesn't affect her acting at all), you would probably enjoy the movie a lot more than you did.The movie is a coming of age film which shows the young generation and the relationship between mother and daughter. If you're lucky enough to be able to see it in one of the very few cinemas it's showing in, please do. The movie is on a VERY limited release and we want it to get expanded so that more of Miley's fans have a chance to see it. Not even just Miley's fans - there's Demi Moore, Ashley Greene, Douglas Booth and more. I'm positive that if you go and watch the movie and give it a chance (without judging Miley for "bad" things she's done in her PERSONAL life) you will actually enjoy it.

reviews.review_title: Same awesome French movie, just more glamorous, less real
reviews.content: Viewed original French version after viewing American version. Same awesome movie. American version is entirely the same movie, just more glamorous and more up-to-American-environment. I don't know if US teenagers are really more glamorous than European, but that makes a slight difference between movies, actually. European version seems more real, while American gives you a hatch to the glamorous life. So every version is better than the other in some way. I guess all the weed is still from European culture, they just didn't want to change the working movie. Or, maybe, I just don't have too many American weed smoking friends, so I underestimate that.So why this huge gap in rating between the two versions? American trolls of Miley Cyrus, I guess.
It's terrible in literally every single possible way.Also, why did Thomas Jane agree to this.
It's just not good. Boring. Flat acting. Just don't do it. Can't believe Thomas Jane acted in this.... he's way too good for a movie this awful.Just don't waste your time.

I really don't understand why this movie has such bad reviews..?! No, it may not be the best movie I've ever seen but I did enjoy it. I think Miley Cyrus' was great as Lola and other supporting characters were good too. The one thing I must say though is I waited for nearly the whole movie for something big and dramatic to happen and it never really did, however overall I think the plot was okay and I didn't get bored or want the film to end. It is a great movie for teenagers, and really shows another side to Miley Cyrus that people may not have seen before.Overall I did enjoy watching this movie and I would recommend it and watch it again.

reviews.review_title: Takes me back to my youth
reviews.content: Absolutely love this film. Heartwarming and relatable. Makes me miss my childhood and being fascinated with boys... thinking the only problems in life were who to date or that my parents didn't understand me. I find it very relatable to my teenage years and it gives me a warm feeling inside. You may have to be in a certain age range in order to appreciate it fully. I.e. you will need to have the ability to remember your actual teenage years! Otherwise it will seem unrelatable and childish. I liked this so much that I bought this on amazon prime... I never buy films - I have Netflix! :) watch, you won't regret it.

I strongly dislike that Lionsgate is not supporting this fantastic film in the USA! Miley has been working hard on movies and this shows how good of an actress she is! She is beyond funny! I think that teenagers all around can relate in some aspect. This movie has good quotes, and is very good. I was beyond excited to see it and I was satisfied. I have a petition of 354 people that say LOL should be played nation wide in the USA not just in 7 theatres. It is rather dumb on Liongates part because of the HUGE budget and they aren't putting it out there to get any of the $ back. They should at least give it a try for a week or something. I recommend this movie for everybody between the ages of 10-65! This is amazing!

The movie is probably the best teen movie ever made. I've watched French version before and I prefer this one. Demi Moore did such a great job as Anne and Miley, perfect. I couldn't get over noticing how people wrote bad reviews for it before even release date (all of them were posted on the exact same date, so probably one person with more accounts) and I find this stupid. If they'd watch the movie, they'd love it. But, back to the movie. It can relate to every teen. I only watched a few clips of the original (French) one before, but I find this one better. The movie sadly won't win any Oscar or anything, because Lionsgate screwed it. The fact that they lost faith in such a good movie makes me sick. They should definitely promote it more, release it worldwide or something and NOT releasing it after 2 years. Anyway, I'm glad I waited for the DVD. I've watched it about 6 times since yesterday, when it arrived. There's a lot of texting in the movie which is great, between Anne and Lola when they text each other " (((( HUG )))) ?" for about three or four times in the movie. You never know what's gonna happen next. 1 hour and a half of the movie went so fast! You should definitely consider watching it and giving it a chance, you won't regret it! :)

I must have sucky taste, because this movie got an average of 3.6 and I loved it! I give it an 8. It was definitely cheesy, and you could predict what would happen, but I loved it anyways. I didn't watch it for an engaging plot, but rather for a warm fuzzy feeling and on that it delivered. I loved the mother/daughter relationship, it seems so real and true to life to me. And Lola's relationship with Kyle was super cute. I don't know, it wasn't a life changing movie but it made me laugh and smile goofily and the screen so I think it was a success. I just really liked it, and I watch it over again from time to time to get those warm fuzzies.

*I don't know how you probably got here, but if you are looking for ACTION/ FANTASY/ADVENTURE/ Sci-Fi/ Rom-Com/ HORROR movie in this one, then I've got a word for you, "GET OUT!" You don't really want to watch this movie.*If you find this movie silly in the first fifteen minutes, then you may not really be into it throughout.*If you liked movies, like "the Last Song", "According to Greta", "Remember Me" and other similar movies, with lots of DRAMA. Then you can watch it, if you are okay with Miley Cyrus, not that great of a Demi Moore and your typical Coming-of-age kinda of movie, then you should probably stick around.*If you aren't approving/comfortable with topics of Sex, drugs and you- know-where-else-I'm probably going with this, then you probably shouldn't watch it.In my opinion, most of the reviews concerned with this film were quite harsh. In truth, the film isn't filled with the perfect story line, with a nail-biting plot or anything. *Like I said, it's a coming-of-age kinda movie and you will enjoy this movie if you've liked other films similar to it like, maybe 'According to Greta, the Last Song and other movies that have the similar theme.*The 'Naration' is sort of tacky and the actors may not have brilliant acting skills, well, in my opinion.*Miley Cyrus over does it at times. And then again, she underplays it sometimes. True to rumours, she does try hard to get out of her 'Hannah Montana' shoes and has tried a more maybe-not-really 'mature' look with this one. All the kissing and the sleeping around speak for that. Nevertheless, I'm don't fan girl or hate on her, so I didn't find her role play that hard to digest, as most other "Hannah Montana" fans might.*You'll find yourself deeply moved by Douglas Booth's role, that's if you have a 'thing' for men, otherwise you'll see that he's just a good- looking guy with average acting skills, well, at least in this movie.*The character of Lola, is pretty well-established, she's rebellious, dubious, confused, she's secretive, loves her mother and is pretty much your average teenager. Meaning to say, your average-unrealistic, drama queenish-ignorant, movie-kinda-teen. *Demi Moore's role may not be the typical control-freak-mum, as much as you might think while watching the movie. I'm not too sure if her role required exceptional acting skills or not, but to me, she really didn't seem to have taken much of an effort. But then again, this was my first movie with Demi Moore in it, so I won't judge. Okay, maybe not too much.* It's NOT one of the greatest movies of all time.*You should probably go sleep, if you're actually taking time off to watch a movie like this one.

reviews.review_title: I loved it! I don't know why it's rated so low
reviews.content: Being a teenager myself, I watched this movie with my mum and we both loved it. I think this is a movie every teenage girl should watch with their mum. I really love this movie and have watched it several times. The relationship between Lola and her mum is amazing. I personally love Kyle and think he is part of the reason why I love this movie so much. Even though this movie is rated so low, I definitely think it is worth watching. I know what you but be thinking, typical teenager with bad taste in movies, but I don't think this is the case, my all time favorite movies are all on the top 100 box office. Definitely worth watching, especially if your a teenager.

A typical plot of an American movie about teenagers. Love, relationship, friendship, betrayal.A film about the difficult relationship of teenagers with the beautiful Demi Moore as a caring mother. I advise young people to watch it, as it raises questions about relationship problems, erroneous judgments and their consequences.The acting is a little lame, there is not enough of this "I really believe", but the film is quite easy to watch. For one time it is quite good.6/10.

LOL is your typical teenage movie. The characters in this movie just experience "normal" teenage problems, however, I feel like these problems aren't the problems an average teenage would face. So, if you're watching this movie for some insight on how to live...turn your back on it. Why? Because the movie focuses more on issues like sex, and drugs. It does focus to some extend on relationships too so that's good. The movie was really well filmed, but the style of filming may have suited a more "deep" story-line rather than this teenage story. I just wish the movie's atmosphere was funner and more alive.This movie turned out to be better than I thought it would be, however, it didn't leave me stunned...I guess this movie is suitable for those boring moments during which you in which you wanna do some dreaded work.

reviews.review_title: LOL no people are sounding pathetic hating this movie because of miley cyrus .
reviews.content: Some of the people reviewing this are only giving it bad reviews because they don't like Miley Cyrus, its pointless, but on the other hand if you take time to listen to the story in the movie it teaches you a less eon on being a teenager . But overall I really did like the movie . Just because you don't like someone doesn't mean you don't have to like what they act in . You don't know the person so why care care about you not someone you don't know it makes you sound pathetic . Just saying I know a lot of people that hate her are gonna make this review in helpful but I really don't care because this movie helped me and it inspired me not who it didn't .

I really enjoyed this movie, I mainly saw it because I'm a fan of Miley Cyrus so I may sound biased.Cons: -A few cast members bothered me, especially a character in the movie named Chad... if you watch this you'll see why. -It can be a little slow to pick up the "plot" of the movie at times -It wasn't long enoughPros: -I think Miley & Demi are great pair as mom/daughter. -This movie is REALLY relate-able to teenagers -Loved the use of technology in the movie -Loved how this movie showed the life of Miley's character, Lola and her Mom's separate life (Demi Moore).Overall, if you're sitting around contemplating to watch this movie, you won't regret it. I definitely will watch it again.

reviews.review_title: Best of Miley's movie ever (until now)
reviews.content: In my opinion, It's not so bad as people said.I saw plenty of dumb review below and feel sorry for them, just because people hate Miley that why those dumb review exist.If you don't believe me just go watch it for yourself and feel.I don't know how but I've watched it 5 times until now, but it still get its own attraction with some scenes combine with good music at the right time.I'm sure that you will watch this movie more than 2 times but be sure that your age must be appropriate for this movie.Of cause it's a little unsuitable for children.That's my review.Thank for reading my review. Just watch it and you 'll see what I meant.

reviews.review_title: Really lovely and feel good movie when you don't want something serious
reviews.content: I real enjoyed this movie! It's very light hearted and easygoing. The perfect sunday movie when you're looking for something to watch that isn't to serious but heartwarming!

Just watched the French one. It's exactly the same plot, but it actually makes sense and the directing fits the coming-of-age style of this film. Miley is... barely passable and I'm glad she's thriving in music now. The dialogue is very cringy especially if you were a teen at the time this was made.

LOL simultaneously nails coming of age existentialism and motherhood life after divorce, all while boasting an entertaining score and gorgeous shots. The filmmakers showed excellent understanding of rich color in a dark contrast style providing a delightful 90 minute visual treat to viewers. I found it very easy to empathize with the struggles of the teen characters and the middle aged Mom. Miley Cyrus is a natural on camera and, paired with Demi Moore, delivers a believable and honest performance. It's rare that I experience a film to be both dark and "feel-good", however this stark contrast and rollercoaster of emotions is what makes this drama worthwhile.

First i'd like to start with the thing that i saw first... HER TEETH i don't mean to be mean but they were crooked and just everywhere  can't they do anything about that but other than that i it was ok i didn't hate it. It had the same concept of every 2015 romance movie like ever. SO other than a hot kyle and miley's teeth theres nothing new or that standed out.

Wow this movie was actually horrible. I watch a lot of 'so bad they're good movies' and I thought that this would be one of those, but no. This movie was legitimately terrible. Firstly, the main character's relationship with her mom is just straight up weird. Literally in the first few minutes of the film she just strips naked in front of her mother. No teenager in their right mind would do that, its just insane. The rest of the movie ranged from cringey, like all of the texting scenes, to straight up confusing. When the main character goes on her trip to France towards the end of the film for some reason her host family consists of a crazy mother and a child who I assume is supposed to be some kind of reincarnation of Joan of Arc. This family also eats brains for no reason, saying that it is the child's favorite food but the child doesn't even eat the brains. My best guess is that this might be a reference to the French version of this film that was released a few years earlier which I haven't seen. However, I think that since this movie is not a sequel or prequal I shouldn't have to watch the other movie in order to understand the absurdity of this movie. As far as the acting goes it was mediocre at best. Miley Cyrus' acting is the same quality as it was on Disney channel, and the supporting actors could easily be seen on a cringey kids tv show right next to her. I would not recommend this movie to anyone, if you're that interested in watching it you might as well just read a 1-Direction fanfic on Wattpad (and yes I know that I didn't even bring up the fact that the romance side of this movie reads like one of those fanfics, but the movie was so bad that it reading like one of those fanfics wasn't even my biggest qualm with it).
Literally why did I waste my time with this movie?

Nice story about the struggles between a mother and her teenage daughter.  The angst of youth, the questions of parenting, and the level of a single mom trying to figure out her own life and how to raise her daughter all combine to make this a watchable movie.  Not a great one, but, as the star system says, it passed the time.

A cringey bunch of nothing! The teenagers' dialogue sounds like it was written by a 46-year-old speaking English as a second language. Demi Moore, at least, did admirably well with what was handed to her. (Also, was the title meant to evoke Lolita? Because it did for me.)

Just wasn't good. Acting=trash and she tries wayyyyy to hard to rebel in my opinion. She gets mad at her mom a lot when all her mom wants to do is protect her. Do I agree that mom her slapped her? Of course not. But at least they worked it out but most of the movie didn't make sense.
A fun, emotional e good movie. It's not a masterpiece but is far from being a bad movie. It's a old movie that you watch to remember of your teenage years.
Such a good sad movie but great for teens to watch..
Miley i love it really the best actres i love you
I liked the sound track, movie was confusing

Either this has been trolled or a lot of people have missed the point. I'm not a fan of Miley Cyrus, but she plays well here with all the other petulant, spoilt kids - and the adults many go on to become - too young and carefree to think. I loved it. Great story line. Cast well. Through and through great movie. You feel all the emotions. I was at first skeptical but I give it 10/10.
perfect definition of teenage life

This movie was absolutely one of the best films of the 21st Century. Like fine wine, this film seems to get better the more I age (am I right ladies). Honestly best movie i have seen in my entire life. 12/10 interesting and overall just amazing and inspirational!!!! Truly moved. I could honestly go on all day about how fantastic this was. Some say this movie has no plot, but those people are truly weak minded and probably 10 years old. Smh.

For a movie cleverly-if-cutesily called "LOL" (main girl's name is Lola, shortened to the ubiquitous internet slang) with the mawkish tagline of "You can change your status but not your heart," there's very little laughing out loud or status changing going on with the characters in the movie, to say even less for the viewing audience.  The teen drama is vague and insipid, born of silly secrets, obvious misunderstandings, and a triangle of near-identical hipster boys.  

Miley Cyrus rocks the honey blonde hair, but she is still scrunchy-faced and faux-angry and probably can't speak a lick of French with her thick drawl.  Ashley Greene, herself, seems to be aware that she's the only twenty-five-year-old-looking super senior fawning over the boys at this school.  Even Demi Moore is wooden.

The title of this movie is indicative of Miley Cyrus¿s acting. I foresee a Golden Razzie in her future. The movie itself had some potential as it takes a look at the life of today¿s teenager with quite a bit of realism¿as much realism as can be expected once it's passed through the filters of Hollywood cameras. I like that the movie took the time to add some dialogue via texting. This is a staple method of communication in the modern world, so it added to the realism. I like the way the chose to film those sequences. This is a challenge that filmmakers are going to have to play around with in upcoming movies if they want to incorporate this real-life method of conversation in their movies--how do you making typing entertaining to watch? On top of the bad acting, Cyrus's character was not very pleasant, verging on loathsome at times, as a smack-talking, disrespectful teen. Am I supposed to want things to go her way or not? It's also hard to transition Cyrus who has been typecast as Nickelodeon¿s Hannah Montana in both the series and "Hannah Montana: The Movie" (2009) into a character that is openly involved in drugs and sex. Demi Moore did do well as the disgruntled divorcee trying to deal with the reckless teen. The soundtrack was filled with indie rock tunes from bands like Freelance Whales and Keane. Again, what saved this movie from disaster is the fact that, although with a Hollywood twist, these are the everyday problems faced by teens are their families today. I'd like to watch the French film "LOL (Laughing Out Loud)" (2008) the movie from which this one was remade.

Lola is a high school virgin living with her single mother and two younger siblings.  Her mother is struggling with an on again off again relationship with Lola's father.  She also has another pursuer.  Meanwhile, Lola is struggling with a complex relationship with her best friend. 

"Those are for bad girls, with bad grades, and no future."

The cast delivers solid performances and also includes Demi Moore, Douglas Booth, Bridget Brown, and Woody Carter.

The movie attempts to be a unique take on a "been there, done that" romantic comedy story.  High school girl, Lola (aka 'Lol' aka Miley Cyrus), thinks she loves a boy, the boy breaks her heart after returning from summer vacation, girl realizes she actually might love her best friend who's, shockingly, been right in front of her the whole time.  There's some typical teenage drama and mediocre comedic attempts throughout the 1.5 hours but, overall, the film was a total miss, for me.

Frankly, I'm not sure what I was expecting when I decided to watch a movie called 'LOL'.  I can't say that I expected it to be great and it definitely wasn't.  It tries to add unique qualities to a dull (and obnoxious at times), teenage love triangle, story by incorporating a "social networking" element to the character's interactions but is more awkward than charming.  Even for a "high school romantic comedy" the characters are really flat and, in the end, I wasn't much of a fan of any of them, or their incredibly superficial relationships with each other.

It's not even a stab at Miley Cyrus or Demi Moore, who play the mother/daughter main characters in the film, because I feel like they could both, probably, do better.  I've definitely seen Demi Moore do better.  'LOL' isn't the worst movie I've ever seen but it's just not that good either.

"LOL" 10 Scale Rating: 3.5 (Bad) ...

The Good: There were a few scenes that were somewhat cute, I suppose. Despite overacting quite a bit, Cyrus was believable as a petulant teenager and Demi Moore was solid as a mother having difficulty understanding her daughter.

The Bad: The beginning is somewhat rushed, seemingly in an effort to shorten the length of the film. Most of the obstacles in the movie are easily remedied and there is little drama when it comes to the actual outcome. Most characters are angry or betrayed in the film for fleeting moments despite what has transpired. Cyrus overacts and the rest of the cast is forgettable.

I thought this movie was a great example of how a parents and son relationship should be, giving the example of mother and daughter relationship. And how when you are a teenager you go through a lot in life and changes. Thus, in this movie the mother (Moore) worried about her daughter (Cyrus) and her decisions, when her daughter was a reflection of her in life. It's just a very true message well played and consistent throughout the movie. I didn't payed attention to much to the acting, but I did noticed that even though I have nothing against Miley Cyrus nor I'm a big fan of her, but she was good in some scenes while in others she lacked credibility. On the other hand I enjoyed a lot the presence of Demi Moore, Douglas Booth and Ashley Hinshaw. Overall it was a better movie than I expected, with many familiar faces some good messages and in general it was very cool and enjoyable.

rt_summary: In a world where connections via Facebook, Twitter and other social media networks are the norm, high-school student Lola (Miley Cyrus) is trying to navigate her way through the usual teen pressures of romance, friendship and overprotective parents (Demi Moore, Thomas Jane). Broken-hearted by a break-up with her boyfriend, Lola's world turns upside-down when she realizes that her best friend, Kyle (Douglas Booth), could actually be the love of her life.
